website_summaries.verdict: While this model may not appeal to all gamers, it's worth considering for those who are looking for an inexpensive MSI model.
pros: Features the brand's Audio Boost function that brings sound to life
Notable memory considering the low price
cons: Can be challenging to install, and it doesn't fit all cases

customer_reviews.title: Great board and worked out of the box on my 3600x
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this board under the impression I was going to have to do the bios update before installing my 3600x. However when I got this package I saw the box was updated to say “ryzen 3000 support”. Even tho the image of this board on amazon shows it saying ryzen 2000. So I figured I would try my 3600x and just see if it would recognize it. And happy to report it did indeed ! Worked right out of the box with my 3600x and 3200mhz viper ram! Great board and I’m happy they updated the bios in the new ones! Made my life a little easier!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Great board for Ryzen 3000 series CPUs
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard has all the right features for a good price. You must update the BIOS before using with a Ryzen 3000 series CPU, but you can do this without a CPU installed, thanks to the Flashback+ feature. Make sure you put the M.2 slot to good use, even the slowest NVMe SSD will greatly increase the speed of your computer. I paired this motherboard with a Ryzen 5 3600 and a Samsung 970 EVO SSD and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Meece III

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT SUPPORT 3600x
customer_reviews.text: So I got this Motherboard and everything was installed, booted it up and the LED next to the CPU light is on, I get no display or any beeps absolutely nothing. I go an search for it and see I am supposed to update the BIOs, so I do that and it booted up. I shut it down goto work and get home power it on and CPU error again and not it won't do ANYTHING at all. It's a known issue that they claim to be working on. This should NOT BE SOLD as supporting the newer CPU's when the firmware is in Beta and doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Morris

customer_reviews.title: Came preinstalled with bios that supports Ryzen 3000 series processors
customer_reviews.text: Brought this motherboard since it was very highly reviewed and came with a bios flashback button to update the bios without even needing to install a processor first. Came preinstalled with bios that supports Ryzen 3000 series processors so I got to use my R5 3600 right away. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard Manual
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard Manual, One of the 1rst things with any Motherboard set up is the Manual. The MSI manual for this motherboard is one of the most comprehensive, it lays things out, so less mistakes will happen and an easier install, I set up an AMD 3rd gen 3600MHZ CPU with Crucial DDR4 3200MHZ memory, O/S Linux Mint 19.3. THE NEED FOR SPEED IN A LINUX SYSTEM. Everything I have added to the board , Works and Just Runs Fast. I added a 1200mbps WiFi/Bluetooth card, fast. I have no issues with this motherboard so far and no bad things to say. I don't do Windows, so I can't comment about how the mother board will do as far as Widows.
customer_reviews.author: TONY DERR

customer_reviews.title: Spend a few extra $ for the MAX Version
customer_reviews.text: For $110 this motherboard isn't that bad. It is based on older, cheaper components, but it still works. My main problem with this motherboard is just how bad the BIOS is because of the fact that this original version does not have enough space to store a higher end BIOS after updating it to support Ryzen 3000. There are also some other things like the fans fluctuating up and down constantly for no real reason and the placement of certain headers. If you really, really don't want to spend ~$10 more for a MUCH better BIOS and most likely more updates, but this instead of the Tomahawk Max. Otherwise, get the Max.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Durden

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Manual included goes over all the headers as well & made everything straightforward. Had some trouble installing the CPU fan, but only because I didn't realize the plate on the back comes off when the clips are removed. Keep in mind you'll need to hold it in place if you get a fan that screws directly into it. Also keep in mind the ram slots are super close to the CPU, and depending on the size of your fan, could end up obstructed. I had to remove & flip mine to access them again. Overall very satisfied. Looks nice and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Zeal

customer_reviews.title: A must buy for Ryzen 2600 owners.
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the best MSI boards I have ever owned. I'm pairing this with the 2600 ryzen 5 and a evga 2080 RTX. While the 2080 RTX doesn't offer much in clearance between the Southbridge sata ports 5 and 6 the temperatures haven't really been a problem under load. Then again it is winter time so I'll keep an eye on it. This motherboard was easy to install and feels very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Sosa

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Friendly!
customer_reviews.text: So I was a little nervous at first as I had bought my PC 6 years ago and have only ever updated fans and GPU so having to replace the motherboard was like WHOA... But this was so simple! I didn't do much research just kind of followed what Amazon says below "Items usually purchased together" LOL and it worked out great. I had to make little to no adjustments and everything just fit exactly where it needed to be!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bohan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good board so far. Fast and responsive, and plenty of IO options to build a worthy gaming PC. The BIOS is easy to work with, has good tooltips and an intuitive interface, and the manual is pretty well-written. RGB lighting options are pretty cool as well. I mainly wish that the CPU reinforcing bracket on the back of the motherboard was adhered to the board somehow. Installing AMD's screw-on heatsink was very difficult since I had to pad the back of the case/motherboard to hold the bracket in place (though this is more AMD's fault for designing a terrible heatsink!).
customer_reviews.author: wolfboy001

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard for Ryzen 5 3600 and GTX 1080ti.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic motherboard at a great price. The tomahawk max do not need factory BIOS update for Ryzen 5 3600 and Nvidia Graphic Card GTX 1080ti. Note that this does not have a WIFI adapter so you will need to buy one.Installation was simple, and the box provided contains TWO Sata Cables (which is ample) but bear in mind this mobo has 6+ SATA ports.
customer_reviews.author: GurungS

customer_reviews.title: Never again,MSI
customer_reviews.text: MSI quality control has been horrible. Their suggested steps cost me a ton of money on top of the build and took so long I couldn't simply send the board back. I'll never order parts from MSI again. Went B450 TM because they dropped the ball hard on the x570 chipset.
customer_reviews.author: John Kubler IV

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard, would recommend to all new and experienced builders.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first computer build, I paired it with an AMD Ryzen 5 3600, and a MSI 2060 Super. The ports were all labeled perfectly making building a breeze. The BIOS was already flashed to be compatible with the 3 series Ryzen processors which is great as flashing a BIOS by yourself can be nerve wrecking. The RGB compatibility is a very nice feature, including the small backlit area on the motherboard that you can sync with other RGB products. After using this MOBO, I couldn't help but recommend it to my brother who was also in the market for a motherboard. To this day we are very pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Caylee Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Solid mobo for beginner
customer_reviews.text: This was my first PC build and I ended up going with this motherboard over the Carbon B450 which has been OOS for quite some time now. The BIOS is extremely user friendly and I've been able to overclock my CPU, memory, and GPU with ease with no issues so far. Would definitely recommend this mobo to those looking for a cheap reliable ryzen build.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S.

customer_reviews.title: First time builder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my very first build and have not been disappointed. It has all the connections I wanted and they were clearly labeled with a great manual to help along the way. Being a first time builder this was what I was most nervous about. The mystic light software is alright it doesn’t have as many options as I would like but it does the job. Very happy with this motherboard overall after a month of having it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi

customer_reviews.title: The B450 King
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, comes well packaged, lots of headers and ports, bios flashback capabilities, the vrms are great, supports 3rd gen ryzen out of the box. Honestly for the price I don't see any other board in the bracket being worth it. The board has also been tested and praised by so many well known users such as Linus, Paul, Jayz2Cents, GamerNexus, it's been put through the ringer. If you need a cheap board that can take a beating, handle overclocking and heat well, is easy to troubleshoot and supports 3rd gen ryzen, just get a MAX and save yourself the trouble. Been using it for a month and I have absolutely no complaints. I also like the Click 5 Bios UI.
customer_reviews.author: J. De Gannes

customer_reviews.title: The first one had a memory controller issue. The replacement has a broken Mem Channel 2.
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of disappointed in the state of these. The headline says it all - the second memory channel is faulty and causes frequent crashes when populated with RAM. I've always built my own PCs and MSI has never really been this bad for me. The functionality alone is great, actually. However, I use my PC for school and work. Since I got the replacement in February, Amazon refused to help me. MSI wants me to send it in and wait 25 days. Anyone who has ever been to college knows what happens if you stop working for 25 days. You fail, and you're out tuition with a permanent black mark on your record.
customer_reviews.author: Elysian

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT SUPPORT RYZEN 4000
customer_reviews.text: I recently decided to build a Ryzen 3000 now because I couldn't wait for the 4000 series. I was thinking that there might be delay because of the Coronavirus. So I purchased this MOBO with a peace of mind that I could just upgrade the CPU in the future. MSi claimed it will support current AM4 CPUs and future AM4 CPUs. Well AMD said no way Jose.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Sicat

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It works how it should. That same easy to use MSI bios, that worked really well with AM4 memory overclocking. CPU got an easy 400mhz overclock without any effort at all really. VRMS stay cool withing the low 30s even after increased voltage on the CPU core. No weirdness, everything just works. Price was good. I would definitely buy this board again if mine were lost or stolen.
customer_reviews.author: glytch

customer_reviews.title: Great board. Limited features but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard. Well built. Quality components. Needs more usb and some 5v fan headers would be great but I'm not going to complain at this price. Bios gets the job done. Software is good enough. Nothing mind blowing. All in all I'd say this is a great option for your Ryzen. Bios flash button is pretty cool. Ran my 3600x with no hiccups. I have several rgb fans I can't use but that is my fault. Highly recommended! MSI is killer. Great brand.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Walls, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent features and performance for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a Ryzen 5 3600 gamer build. It has excellent features, great performance and was reasonably priced. I rated tech support five stars because I haven't needed to use it, which to me is the best possible tech support. If I have any issues I will review the rating. I had zero problems with the install, it recognized all of my devices, the CPU and memory, no flash bs at all. It even breezed right on by my Optane PCIE SSDD and booted right up to it. No drama whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzman

customer_reviews.title: Good match for AMD A6-7400K Processor
customer_reviews.text: Used this motherboard for a custom built Security/Home Automation PC. Booted first time without any issues. Included documentation good and MSI support Website adequate, though can be confusing. Using the on-board video which is more than adequate for my purposes. However, the video becomes disabled if no monitor is attached, cumbersome for a "headless" operation. Had to order a dummy HDMI dongle to keep video active for Remote VNC "Headless" operation.
customer_reviews.author: Bayou Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high-quality buy
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t have any trouble with this motherboard. Manual was very descriptive and easy to use. Packed with features at a good price: plentiful fan and RGB headers, M2, 4 slot RAM. My only gripe was that the stock AM4 cooler comes right up to the RAM slots which can limit airflow. Seems like a design oversight. Also the SATA ports are behind the GPU so you might run in to trouble trying to plug them in if you’ve already installed the GPU. I love the BIOS. Very user-friendly and easy to set up auto fans, CPU clocks, RAM clocks. Overall highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mellon

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 5 3600x does not work with motherboard MSI B450 Tomahawk
customer_reviews.text: Flashed the motherboard's BIOS to the latest version and it didn't do anything to help it work. The CPU works, the motherboard works, but they won't work together. You need the B500-series or later if you want the CPU to work. Huge waste of money. If you're sick and tired of having to do techno-magic to get your computer parts to work, just skip AMD all together. This waste of money was the last nail in the coffin for AMD, I'm making the switch to Intel.
customer_reviews.author: This Guy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: A touch funky at first but ran zen 2 out of the box. Stable. Good for my oc of 4.3 on all cores of my r3600 p95 stable. 16 gigs of 3200 Corsair. Evga sc 980ti oc even further. Good board. Would like a second m2 socket.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Thompson

customer_reviews.title: For gen 3 Ryzen, just go buy a b550 or x570
customer_reviews.text: Paired with my 3600x, there was a problem with bootdown in the bios (something to do with voltage to the processor). Contacted msi support about it and they asked me to dismantle my pc and send them the motherboard so they could check it out. Instead of doing that and probably going weeks without a pc I just upgraded to a gigabyte b550 and have been smooth sailing ever since. On top of that issue, msi's dragon center software is very buggy hard to work with. When it was working though it was frustrating, but acceptable and for those reasons I wouldnt give it more than a 2.5.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Hunt

customer_reviews.title: DOA, Didn't work with 2600x
customer_reviews.text: DOA. I'm building a PC for a co-worker and they couldn't afford to pay all at once. So I purchased what I could as they gave me the funds. Guess I should've made this this last purchase because it doesn't work, at all. I've tried to update BIOS in every fashion. I've literally tried EVERYTHING you would do to rule out components creating the problem. Now it's passed the 30 day return window and I can do squat about it.
customer_reviews.author: DeadWreckeningX

customer_reviews.title: B450 Tomahawk
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use tech support so i can't speak to that, but the bard is nice. I do prefer Asus bios software and configuration, but this isn't bad. I was able to figure out where everything was. no issues with supported components except for recognizing the NVMe SSD drive. But bios updates and reboots fixed that. Ryzen 7 2700 Adata SU 800 Ultimate AMD RX 580 XPG Z1 DDR4 3200 16gb memory XPG Gammix S5
customer_reviews.author: lionlam

customer_reviews.title: Great MB
customer_reviews.text: After reading lots of online reviews, I decided to go with this MB for my recent build. I am not a gamer, I develop software for my job, so stability and reliability are most important to me. Paired with a Ryzen 2600X and a 1TB M.2 drive the my Linux system boots almost instantaneously and has been rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: dogsled

customer_reviews.title: avoid msi avoid amd ryzen 3000. get intel
customer_reviews.text: so much for false advertisement on am4 platform supporting newer gen cpu. motherboard doesnt even post or boot with new bios flashed in. theres a reason amd sucks. go with intel, they always work out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Vinh Tran

customer_reviews.title: One Defective, But Good Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I've had this board for awhile now so I feel comfortable writing this review. The first one I got worked, but the RGB functionality was not working properly. I really wanted the RGB to work on my build so I ordered a replacement which worked flawlessly. It happens. This board had everything I wanted for a good price and the colors... I love the neutral scheme. I really recommend this board. It was easy to use for my first build, everything was labeled and I had a joy building off this board. Trust me, I searched for a solid board that checked all my boxes for weeks before ordering one and I ended up choosing this one.
customer_reviews.author: TERRY M. ROBINSON

customer_reviews.title: Faulty PCIe slot
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine except the first PCIe slot, which was faulty. Pretty significant problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bunnies

customer_reviews.title: Contained a Colony of Ants
customer_reviews.text: When I opened it, found a colony of ants (large ones, not the teeny tiny ones) inside of it. I did my best to pull out the contents of the box one by one, holding back the urge to scream, and clean the ants off before setting it aside. Meanwhile, my wife maintained a perimiter around me with RAID and a hand-held vacuum to keep them from getting too far into our house. After removing all the components from inside the main box, ended up just RAIDing the remaining packaging and tossing it. Wish I had thought to take photos, but was in panic mode. I still tried to install the motherboard. It BSODs a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get!
customer_reviews.text: Ryzen 3 2200g This mobo Corsair Vengeance RGB Pro 3200 (16 Gb) It is all working well together. Using mobo Game Boost and X-AMP got memory running at 3200 and CPU up from 3.5 to 3.75 just buy clicking 2 buttons in BIOS. BIOS has nice interface and is easy to use. MSI MysticLight has a nice interface and is very easy to use. UPDATE: NZXT H500i case runs quieter when the 2200g is overclocked via Ryzen Master software as opposed to MSI Game Boost button.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Worked as it should - and was priced $20 less than normal..... shipping was horribly slow - was to come BEFORE XMAS, then the 28th...then the...... How can someone say it will arrive on a date - yet it has never shipped? Son was really disappointed getting it 2 weeks after Xmas. However - the board works well and he is smiling with his new found computer speed!
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone85

customer_reviews.title: Decent Mother Board For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: I built a new 2700x system and had no problems setting up and installing a bios update. My Corsair Vengeance 3200 ddr4 ram worked out of the box. I had to enable a XMP profile and set the frequency to 3200. Update: With 2 sticks of 3200 ram xmp worked fine. When I added 2 more sticks I am unable to clock the ram above 2666. Other than that I am very happy with this board, so far seems rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Greg From Oregon

customer_reviews.title: A good look and an even better performer
customer_reviews.text: The B450 runs my Ryzen 3600 like a charm, having it ready out of the box without any bios updates was the main reason i got this one. Also it was not too difficult to set up all my components onto it and I think this was definitely my best choice. The RTX 2060 I have hooked up also went on easy. I would reccommend this plus having some RGB is always welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio D.

customer_reviews.title: It's worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I built this with corsair vengeance memory and a 750 watt power supply, also a cheap graphics card and 1tb western blue hard drive, ryzen 5 2600 processor. It boots in 8 seconds This is about my 7th build and by far my favorite. This has the coolest bios I've ever seen. Love it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: MSI Tomahawk B450 MB
customer_reviews.text: The BIOS has gone back to looking like BIOS that I haven't seen in a decade, no more easy BIOS. I tried flashing the Bios to the latest version and got a black screen, the BIOS hung up on start, never prompted for USB device of file. Turned off PSU then I removed the CMOS battery (a few minutes) to reset the motherboard to factory setting. The second attempt to upgrade the Bios worked
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Board.
customer_reviews.text: Had a gigabyte 990x board that was slowly dying. Lost use of all PCI slots. Did some research, and everything about this board filled all my requirements. No issues in installing board or drivers. Bios was a little different than what I was used to, but was easy to work with. Update: No problems with this board. Updated bios and installed Ryzen 5 3600. System is running smoothly. Gained 700pts in Cinebench r20 vs the 2600.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Gaming Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a rock-solid motherboard. The BIOS has a nice GUI and built-in options for performance and for voltage overclocking. Runs Ryzen 5 CPUs like a champ with the option to get a Ryzen 7 in the future. The aRGB lights under the board and onboard connectors work nicely under Windows with the Mystic Lights software; I've had some luck with "msi rgb" and OpenRGB under Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Prisco

customer_reviews.title: Audio is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Sick and tired of clicks and pops in mp3 playback. Driver after driver download of the realtek steaming pile. Nothing helps. Audio is garbage. Edit: So after installing an ancient sound blaster, that Win 10 apparently has drivers for?? After a brief moment of jubilation...Clicks and Pops persist. Not necessarily an issue with this board. Indeed in the process of troubleshooting I am back onto it. And not sure where to lay blame - I am giving Win 10 the side eye though.
customer_reviews.author: P. Rauch

customer_reviews.title: Super easy with Rizen 2600X
customer_reviews.text: Part of the easiest build in over 20 years. Used AMD Rizen 2600x and G-Skill 3200 memory. The only thing I had to do was set XMP and memory speed was automatically set. Also, XFR auto over clocked CPU. Used a SP NVMe M.2 and is super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy E. Graveman

customer_reviews.title: Rdb sucks but rest is good.
customer_reviews.text: Install went smooth enough but man do the rgb options with the LEDs suck.. If you made a board this good and chose to gi e it rgb why would you not go all the way with it? It's super cheap to add great rgb functionality on a production side so why skimp? Oh... Also there is a bright red dot of paint in the middle of the board that kinda triggers me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with 3rd gen Ryzen Processors
customer_reviews.text: I bought this MoBo when I was having PC issues and I thought my ASRock 320 might be the issue. Unbeknownst to me when I purchased it, the Tomahawk came with the Bios update needed to recognized 3rd gen Ryzen processors. Even so, I flashed the bios before installing the new CPU and haven't had any issues. You can download software from MSI to change the LED on the back of the board to give a nice RGB effect, if you're into that. (Be into that)
customer_reviews.author: Matt McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Runs great for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming! This is an amazing board that I have waited so long to come back in stock. I have had no problems with it yet a few months since building my second pc and everything runs smoothly. Con- My only problem with it was the Manual on installing showed to put 4 screws in each corner but there are other screws that needed to be put in middle with the brackets(brackets go behind board). I just had to take off the board after I started plugging stuff in because the board gets alittle movement if you don’t have the All support brackets behind.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Good for 3900X
customer_reviews.text: Works well with a 3900X. I was looking for a reasonably priced motherboard with VRMs that could support PBO on the 13 core beast. This board works well. My 3900X pulls 170W (package) on an all core load (Cinebench R20). The board has no issues with this. I only care about CPU performance on this machine. I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: DanK

customer_reviews.title: very cool looking  motherboard for any build
customer_reviews.text: at first i was worried since a lot of people said i should get a x470 motherboard instead of waiting for this one. but i didn't listen to them and im glad i did. this motherboard is a great option for people who wants to start building PC without breaking the bank. im using this as my first build and not only does it look very nice. it offers a lot for its affordable price. i will be making more PC in the future and i still would probably pick up this motherboard for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard works good. Price is also affordable although at this price point you can spend another $20 or so and get slightly upgraded motherboards. Nonetheless, this motherboard has not yet failed me nor was it difficult to work with from scratch (take into consideration that I have grade school knowledge of PCs and this is my first motherboard and have owned it for a few months now).
customer_reviews.author: Yang

customer_reviews.title: Got what I paid for...!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried if this MSI motherboard would work with the Ryzen 3000 series processors and I must say; never worked better! Ryzen 3000 series ready out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Barrimore Ikenna Gore

customer_reviews.title: 1 month in and I am perfectly happy
customer_reviews.text: great mobo and easy to install. It did not need a bios update and came ready to go with my ryzen 3600 so this made the bios/windows install easy to use for a first time builder. The only thing I would say is to be aware of the heatsink on the rear io while installing your cpu cooler. The plastic piece that displays the AMD logo on my stock cooler was pressing up on the heatsink, not a huge deal but something to be aware of. Would totally recommend if you are going team red
customer_reviews.author: Jay C

customer_reviews.title: Has everything I need in a mobo
customer_reviews.text: I did a ryzen 5 3600 build with a rtx 2060 ko gpu and a b450 tomahawk max mobo. All the parts work perfectly together and I can play AAA games on ultra settings at 60fps and higher. This mobo has tons of hookups for everything and since it’s the b450 max, it was already compatible with my CPU. I just hooked up all the components and the system booted up fine with no extra steps. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Replaced  first board, second board no problems.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the first board and received a replacement quickly. The first board wouldn't fire up, replace the power supple, no luck.. Returned the board to Amazon, and quickly got the second board, No problems, works as it should. Amazon makes it east to return items, especially since I live close to a UPS store.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: OK I guess
customer_reviews.text: Good packaging and relatively easy to install. The bios, like a lot of MSI Bios is a bit buggy. Mine won't pass POST and boot unless I hit the reset button EVERY TIME I turn the computer on. As much as I hate to screw with the bios, I guess I will have to re-flash it. Don't expect much help from MSI. Their website is especially bad and product registration is unusually and unnecessarily complicated. You can't even get to their online forums without jumping through numerous and ridiculous hoops. One evening I tried for over a 1⁄2 hour just trying to sign in. 😡😡😡
customer_reviews.author: nicobie

customer_reviews.title: Best board for beginners; great for enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard. The fact that it has USB 3.0, USB C and tons of USB 2.0 slots on the I/o is great. Easy to install, layout is great and speeds are top notch. For a little over 100 bucks, it can't be beat. This is especially great for beginners because it's so popular, there are plenty of discords and videos on how to do things with it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Graham

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: If tech support relates to MSI's product support, then it's bad. I asked for an I/O shield that didn't come in the box, and have been ignored or rejected multiple times. For this reason, I won't be buying another MSI product again. Meanwhile Fractal design are sending me out a new audio kit for my case free of charge just from a brief email with them. Other than that, the board works fine with my 3600. But for many others it didn't and that brings another reason not to go with MSI as their support has been lacking.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it. USB flashback doesn't work. Doesn't support Ryzen 3000
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions but the USB flashback just doesn't work. I used a 8gb USB 2.0 pendrive to do the flashback. The first time the LED indicator blinked as expected but my system with Ryzen 3600 did not boot. I tried to reflash the BIOS but the LED just stayed solid red this time, not reading from the pendrive at all no matter how many times I tried. MSI claims after a BIOS update this board would support Ryzen 3000 on their website, but it does not atm. There are so many people having issues with the BIOS update for Ryzen 3000.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE, WOULD RECOMEND
customer_reviews.text: at first I bought an ASUS board, and got the box opened and after setting it up and dealing with customer service, the board was just broken. I was fed up with ASUS and I bought this MSI board and I was amazed. The manual is easy to read and understand, the bios is easy to use and overclock. Overall a great board, looks great and works fantastic, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Good budget board
customer_reviews.text: I got this refurbished, but it looked practically brand new. I was going for an all black theme and this looks so good in it! My only complaint is that it was not detecting my cpu (Ryzen 5 1600) and would not power on. After lots of headache and research, I found out that I needed to update the BIOS. I was able to do this with just a flash drive so very simple. I would think with an older Ryzen model it wouldn't need an update but it was the only way this would power on. If yours isn't detecting the cpu then I would try updating the bios first. Make sure only the psu is plugged into it.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Really good mother board It can run the new third Jan and CPU I will warn you. You have to update the bios in order for it to work with these new CPUs there is a slight bottleneck with the CPU but I would give in the performance of the new CPUs a solid four if you cannot afford the new motherboards for amd this one I would recommend
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am not seeing the overall performance I would expect from the build and the reviews. I have only used this thing for email and web browsing with some light audio editing. It can't make it through a full day without being restarted from getting bogged down or slowed down for whatever reason. You would think I had 8 programs running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Sleep or Shutdown properly
customer_reviews.text: It works when its on. There were no issues with installing a AMD Ryzen 5 2600X Processor and it accepted it and the Cosair RAM without issues. However the motherboard doesn't shutdown or go to any kind of power saving mode. It turns everything off but the motherboard stays on. It requires a hard reset to recover from anything, including a restart. MSI support hours are limited and only available when most people are at work. Lack of a audio TOSLINK optical port was also a minus. Currently working through Amazon support and will update this review with any changes.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to OC and to install ryzen 5 3600
customer_reviews.text: What an easy installation! I swapped out my 10yr old mobo to this one so i can install ryzen 5 3600. Bios is super easy to maneuver and to OC. I installed a 16gb ram (which i think ill add another 16gb). updated the drivers and utilities. (Some but not all utilites can be redundant since you can OC ryzen and the ram with a click.) With 2 clicks my ryzen 5 3600 is at 4.1gb and my ram is at 3600mhz. Super easy. The wraith cooler is silent. Does the job. Im more of a rgb type so im going to switch in the future.
customer_reviews.author: luis391

customer_reviews.title: This is a steal deal
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing deal for $120. It has 6 SATA ports, an M.2 drive, and plenty of PCI ports for expansion cards. This motherboard offers great overclocking capabilities for such a low priced board. Its design is simple, sleek, and flawless. I had 2 discomforts with this product: 1. The M.2 screw was hard to get in, but that's the same with any motherboard. 2. The RAM, its a little confusing with RAM, because the motherboard says its 2133mhz, but in XMP mode it can support 3600mhz. Which I had to ask around for some help with setting it up. No problems afterwards. Overall, the price, the product, the marketing, is all a masterpiece. I'd recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A High Quality Board At a Quality Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this board as a replacement from an old LGA1150 board to upgrade to the new Ryzen 3600x. Haven't received my CPU yet, but getting the board set up was a breeze. The ability to flash an update to the board without needing to set up the whole computer was amazing. It's a very sturdy, high quality board, with no unneeded flashy RGB aside from some on the backside. The layout of the pins and sockets actually made cable management easier than my last board. Everything plugs in and can be tucked away and wrapped up nicely. 5/5 stars here, would recommend to anyone needing a decently priced board for current gen Ryzen chips.
customer_reviews.author: Derek M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance For Value!
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this motherboard in June and couldn't be happier. The board includes support for one M.2-NVMe SSD, 2-way AMD CrossFire support, obvious B450 chipset, pairs nicely with my Ryzen 5 2600 CPUs with room for upgrading, works well with the RX 580 GPU, excellent onboard 7.1 audio and rock solid stability running Windows 10 1903. No complaints whatsoever! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Danny C.

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRICE AND A GOOD BOARD!
customer_reviews.text: I was building a new gaming PC for myself and it's my first one. I did tons of research and this board came up with good reviews and that's why I want to continue with that so other people will look into this board. At first I thought it would suck and then I got it, put together my PC and it worked FANTASTIC. With my AMD RYZEN 5 2600 (NOT THE "X") I use it everyday from gaming, to video editing, all the way to writing amazon reviews at 10:00 PM. This board is such good quality for its fantastic low price...this is a no brainer buy for anyone wanting to build a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: this motherboard worked flawlessly with my ryzen 5 3600x and my rtx 2060 super its so easy and plug and play. What more could you ask for a motherboard? it even has two JRGB connectors that sync up with the rgb leds on the back of the motherboard they are super nice!
customer_reviews.author: Ledger Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play for a Ryzen 5 3600, no BIOS update needed.
customer_reviews.text: Quite an upgrade from my old H97 chipset. Coming from an m-ATX build to an ATX, this is quite a unit to put together. However, it has plenty of IO and SATA connections. Used the BIOS to enable Game Mode into 4.2 Ghz using the stock Wraith Stealth cooler out of the box. If you have any doubts about getting this for a Ryzen 5 3600, get it!
customer_reviews.author: Neil Viray

customer_reviews.title: First build!
customer_reviews.text: Built my first tower and after a bit of back and forth, pulled the trigger on this motherboard and glad I did. The thing is sexy! Threw a AMD Ryzen 7 2700x on it and a few G. Skill RAM sticks, it is NICE! Very pleased with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Todd T.

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive board and no problems
customer_reviews.text: Great board and easy to overclock ... updates easy to do and can be done through Windows ... try it you will like it .... running Ryzen 2700x and like them both .. Am getting to where I don’t even read bad reviews because somethings they write negative comments I think to just write negative comments ... I think they would write a negative comment even if it was given to them ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Motherboard in the market.
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is the absolute best. It has everything you need. Fan headers, plenty of sata ports, and a nice red rgb glow on the back of the motherboard to finish off this beast of a motherboad. It's extremely easy to update this motherboard too, just a touch of a button and it's done! This board is absolutely perfect to me and it hasnt failed so far. I recommended it to my friend and he hasn't had any problems so far! However, this is a motherboard that DOES NOT HANDLE OVERCLOCKING WELL. If you want to overclock, I suggest you buy an x470. Overall, it's a great motherboard and it'll fit really nice in a red and black theme!
customer_reviews.author: Axel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-around Board
customer_reviews.text: The MSI B450 Tomahawk is an excellent motherboard that I have used in multiple builds. The MSI BIOS is easy to navigate and provides great options for preset overclocking. Allthough the software by MSI is simple, it is very responsive and has been great for me to use since I began PC building. If your are looking for a reliable, well-designed board that will fit into any system and that has a classic neutral color scheme, this is an excellent choice. Supporting both Ryzen 2nd and 3rd gen, it is reliable and will provide good upgradeability. It is a perfect choice for new PC builders and people looking for solid performance and a good-looking design.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C. Chemery

customer_reviews.title: works with my Ryzen 2600x
customer_reviews.text: got it for my ryzen 5 2600x. Worked of the bat and nothing much to say about it. the memory configuration is a little differnt. you'll need to follow the instructions to place it in the correct slots. running a 1070 ti and 16gb of ram. so far so good. good price.
customer_reviews.author: DanyoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: 1st motherboard died, 2nd was DOA
customer_reviews.text: My first purchase fired up on first boot and was PERFECT. For 9 months. Then it died, never to power on again. Shrugged it off and bought the same board since they're reasonably priced. It was dead on arrival. Took it to a professional who confirmed my suspicions. Now I've got two dead motherboards and a non-working PC. Buddy bought the same board one week prior and his was ALSO DEAD ON ARRIVAL. Ordered a new one and MSI sent him the wrong motherboard. STAY AWAY THESE BOARDS. NOT WORTH THE HEADACHE.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Mohmand

customer_reviews.title: Ready for Ryzen 5 3600x etc.  Bios easy to use. Solid Performance.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best b450m motherboards I’ve used. Layout is exceptional. Plenty of fan connectors and rgb connectors. MSI bios is simple to use. Ready out of the box for Ryzen 5 3600x. This board is also a beautiful silver/grey design. Works well with lots of other components.
customer_reviews.author: FpsMafia

customer_reviews.title: Good instructions manual + Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest custom built PC I've done and I must say this is the best written manual for a motherboard and how to be installed. Very easy to follow instructions and with little effort get yourself ready to hit the floor and run. I didn't use tech support so I couldn't rate. The box includes everything you need, manual, cables and screws
customer_reviews.author: Niklas Henricson

customer_reviews.title: I would keep doing some research if I was thinking about buying this mobo.
customer_reviews.text: I used this mobo for about three months before the sounds jack would make a static noise that wouldn't go away. I tried to trouble shoot it by updating divers, uninstalling audio drivers and reinstalling. I ended restarting the os and the sound presisted. From reading multiple threads I came to the conclusion that the mobo was defected and bought another compatible mobo with my computer parts.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Aranda

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product until they fix BIOS update
customer_reviews.text: Tried everything to get my rig into Bios with 3600 but was not possible. If you are using a 3000 don’t bother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMD 2600X
customer_reviews.text: Not a single problem with it. It also looks good in my black NZXT 500 black. Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Public name this is

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ATX form-factor motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was easy to install and wire-up, and even came with metal back-plate for mounting the CPU heat-sink/fan assembly. Using an AMD processor and a 6Gb/second SSD, this thing runs absurdly fast. Setup is also easy, with the BIOS popping up with a number of settings and auto-adjusting options upon first boot-up. It even notifies you if you've installed the RAM cards in a non-optimized fashion, which I did. Be sure to install RAM into slots 1 and 3 first.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Brillhart

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ryzen 5 3600 right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Best motherboard under $150 and it works with the Ryzen 5 3600 right out of the box. It has a pretty good BIOS and the board itself is well made for the price range. Very happy with my purchase. I made a new PC for my wife, and popped a 2060 Super in there, and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Roderic Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my first PC build
customer_reviews.text: This Mobo deserves all of the positive reviews it has received. Quality build, plenty of power connections, and simple to use Bios. The variety of support it comes with compared to other boards, especially at this price range, is amazing. Definitely recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen 3000 compatible
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this board thinking that I would need a BIOS update, but it came out of box for the Ryzen 3000 series. Was very pleased with that. The board itself is sleek and the color scheme matches my build.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett M.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best budget options with even the new AMD CPUs
customer_reviews.text: We got this after AMD announced it would have Zen 3 support for these MOBOs. It is a great option for low budget builds and even mid-range. We were lucky with no pins came dead on arrival etc. Though, the box came somehow damaged or used. (We didn't send it back because the stock was an issue at the time of purchase because of COVID-19) It is working nicely so far but know that there are better options, now with B550s out there you might consider that.
customer_reviews.author: Yigit Kucuk

customer_reviews.title: MSI all the way
customer_reviews.text: I own this for a year now very happy no problems love MSI any way been using there product for many years hope this one last as long as my other MSI mother board 760GM-p34 FX is still running no problems going 8yrs now MSI quality products if your into gaming want to save money but not give up features this is the mobo I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: pedro j

customer_reviews.title: *ryzen 3000 ready*it works and was shipped with updated bios
customer_reviews.text: I was worried after reading some of the other reviews but after getting the Mobo, I am happy to say everything works! It shipped with updated bios and was ryzen 3000 ready out of the box! Check the box before installing with a 3rd gen ryzen cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah warren

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: looked up reviews for this board months before updating. works alot better than the old board i had in here got alot of fan slots and two rgb 4 pin connections. running windows 10 with 16gb of ram ryzen 5 1600 gtx 1070 ti. havnt had no issues so far with my games runs real smooth. i def will recommend this board to anyone i talk to.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Dean III

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but issues with this board. I was swayed by the positive reviews on this to pair with a 3600x but the BIOS seems to be completely unstable. Neither the new or previous BIOS releases would allow me to get past the windows 10 log in screen without the screen immediately turning black. Setting a manual fan curve in the BIOS didn't seem to save either. Although this board is a very enticing, a lot of people have had similar issues, so if you're looking for a frustration free process I would seriously look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the company that sold me this motherboard. It was defective and I had to send it back. There is no reason for a customer to have to pay for return shipping on an item that is defective. I contacted the seller and they said they will not be reimbursing me for this defective item. If I would have destroyed this item I would understand having to pay for return shipping. Be cautious ordering from this company, they may send you a bad product and then you have no choice but to pay to have it returned. Bad choice of a purchase option.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Ayon

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with my purchase. With soooo many mother boards out there, this one was perfect for me. Really friendly overclocking for CPU, RAM, and GPU. MSI makes good products which is one of the reasons I chose this one
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Received a dead unit
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't working so I went out and bought a new power supply. Still didnt work even when I tried to jump start it by touching the correct pins with a screwdriver. Swapped it out with a different motherboard and the other one worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kenji

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have a Ryzen 3600 and having no issues. Came with the Ryzen 3000 series ready sticker A must buy
customer_reviews.author: Hyoung Jin Kim

customer_reviews.title: Watch out
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a a few days past the return policy and it just bricked on me one day would not personally recommend better boards out there for less problems
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Bios update preflashed for Ryzen 3000
customer_reviews.text: Shipped with "Ryzen 3000 desktop ready" PRINTED on the box. Running well, out of the box, with Ryzen 5 3600.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded my PC for the first time in ten years and switched to AMD. This motherboard was highly recommended and I was able to install and get a POST very quickly and with no inconvenience. I am very happy with the product. My only dislike so far is the red LEDs that are present on the back of the motherboard, but that is a minor cosmetic concern. I am very happy with the system overall. Don't forget to go into the BIOS to enable to full speed of your RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J Dunbar

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy USED, Spend the extra money and get NEW
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product used for my first build, slowly buying my parts over a 6-8month time period, then once I had all my parts I assembled them together and nothing. After some trouble shooting I discovered the motherboard was a DOA. Lesson: don’t be cheap and buy used parts, just get them new.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Lapham

customer_reviews.title: Super Solid MoBo
customer_reviews.text: I actually didn’t have high hopes for this thing at first. I saw it as a cheap way to start building my first pc. I was mistaken. The board feels sturdy, the heat sink actually works pretty well in keeping everything cool. The LED lights that help Debug things helped so much that I’m pretty sure I’d have given up if there wasn’t anything to guide me on what was wrong. I’m definitely going to buy this board again for my next build.
customer_reviews.author: Erick R.

customer_reviews.title: I think its dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I would have no complains for this product if it worked. I baught this motherboard intended for ryzen 5 3600x but couldnt get it to work. When plugging the power supply to the mothrrboard with the 24 pin and 8 pin cables, i get no LED to light up, psu fan doesnt spi, tried adding rgb ram to see if the ram light flashes but nothing worked. And ive tested the psu a couple of times, it works 100%. I will return the board soon, but really hope there is a chance to fix it because returning the mobo will only cost me more time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: First Board was Dead, CORRECT replacement board worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: It's working great so far, the BIOS was easy to navigate and i'm having no issues now. Unfortunately I have to dock points because I got a dead board first. Amazon then sent me a replacement of the incorrect model, so I had to wait another week to get that fixed. This time I just got a refund and bought the correct version myself, but THEN amazon sent me TWO motherboards at the same time. So now I have to return three giant boxes, and was essentially unable to work for a month because of these slip-ups.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cheema

product_meta.title: MSI Arsenal Gaming AMD Ryzen 1st and 2nd Gen AM4 M.2 USB 3 DDR4 DVI HDMI Crossfire ATX Motherboard (B450 TOMAHAWK)
product_meta.description: Style:B450 TOMAHAWKFeaturing heavy plated heat sinks and fierce looks, MSI ARSENAL GAMING motherboards are packed with gaming features for a refined gaming experience. MSI Audio Boost delivers the highest sound quality through the use of premium quality audio components. This lets you enjoy breathtaking, game-changing sound to create the most exciting gameplay. MSI motherboards are crammed with features to fuel your gaming rig's memory with more speed, higher overclock ability and increased stability.
feature_bullets: Support AMD Ryzen 1st and 2nd Generation / Ryzen with Radeon Vega Graphics Processors for Socket AM4
Supports 64gb dual channel ddr4 memory 1866/ 2133/ 2400/ 2667 MHz by jedec, and 2667/ 2800/ 2933/ 3000/ 3066/ 3200/ 3466 MHz by a XMP OC mode
In game weapons: Game boost, gaming hotkey, x boost; Ez debug led: Easiest way to troubleshoot
Gaming certified: 24 hour on and offline game and motherboard testing by esports players.lan chipset:realtek 8111h.maximum shared memory of 2048 MB

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,277 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
